intro: Micrampelis watsonii, commonly known as the Watson's climbing plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Micrampelis watsonii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments.
